15TH Thessaloniki Documentary Festival

Images of the 21st Century

15th 24th of March 2013

Press Release

The 15th Thessaloniki Documentary Festival Images of the 21st Century is going to be held at the halls Olympion, Pavlos Zannas, John Cassavetes, Stavros Tornes, Frinda Liapa and Tonia Marketaki, from 15th to 24th of March 2013. The Festival is going to attempt to make the audience aware of some crucial topics that require its critical stance and participation, in order to be resolved. The large catalogue of the selected documentaries and the conversations, the speeches, the master-classes and the exhibitions -that are going to accompany the screenings- are the mediums of the Festival.

The Thessaloniki Documentary Festival – Images of the 21st Century celebrates its 15th anniversary and honors the highly creative, cinematic, socially-committed and constantly evolving art of the documentary by presenting a collection of beloved films that epitomize the Thessaloniki Documentary Festival from its inception until today.

The selected documentaries challenged perceptions, exposed truths, entertained, provoked fruitful dialogue and helped shape the Festival character, playing a formative role in its journey throughout the past 15 years. Many of the both acclaimed and neophyte filmmakers that made the films attended the Documentary Festival, to present and discuss them with the Thessaloniki audiences, enriching the viewing experience and providing valuable insight. The anniversary tribute is named 15 Festival Years: a Fascinating Journey. In Addition, a special tribute to the Chilean documentary film director Patricio Guzman is planned. He will be at Thessaloniki, in order to meet his audience.

The tribute 15 Festival Years: an Fascinating Journey, the homage to Patricio Guzman, the festivals sections HUMAN RIGHTS, SOCIETY AND ENVIRONMENT, VIEWS OF THE WORLD, STORIES TO TELL, PORTRAITS: HUMAN JOURNEYS, GREEK PANORAMA, all the Greek documentaries of the festival, the photographic exhibition Thessaloniki 101 and the happenings at Thessaloniki Film Achieves are sponsored by the European Union – European Regional Development Fund 2007-2013.
